content.description: Sit start on the large rail and then continue upwards using the many rails on this face of the boulder to a higher but easy top out.
content.location: Directly left of the prow on the main trail's side of the boulder.

content.description: In about the center of this face is a feature that juts out... Start below and to the left a bit of this. Work your way up by using said feature and then trend right for the top!
content.location: Center of the main trail's side of Lookout Boulder

content.description: Just a heads up, the top out for this problem can be rather sketchy.  Use the steps on the lookout to walk up and check if it is dry and clear of moss/lichen.   Sit start at the bottom of the prow and work up both sides.  The top out is on the left side of the point.  Look for a solid right-handed jug near the top and then beach whale it secure the send!
content.protection: Pads of crash on the ground and opposing boulder.  This can be considered a high ball for the area and layering pads when the climber is near the top is suggested. Spotter(s) needed.
content.location: Back side of the Lookout Boulder on the large, semi-overhung prow.

content.description: Oh yello there!  This is a mighty-fine section that most of the foot traffic is directed to at Beartown.  Atop the tallest boulder is a fenced-in lookout where one can see the layout of Beartown and onwards to Cook Forest. Expect other people to be there and a bit of gawking from onlookers.
